items.name: ðŸŽŠNew Year's DayðŸŽŠ
items.description: Wishing you a New Year filled with joy and prosperity.

items.name: Phool Rogan
items.description: A signature dish from Kashmir in a delightful vegetarian twist with cauliflower as the main ingredient. The dish has flawless red color due to the use of Kashmiri chillies. In addition, saffron/rattan jot is also added to the curry for the crimson red color.
items.extra: make it a meal with rice + side salad + achar + papad

items.name: Rogan Josh
items.description: A Kashmiri dish where lamb meat is slow cooked and added to a base of yogurt, spices, and onions. A warm and flavourful dish.
items.extra: make it a meal with 2 parathas + side salad + achar + papad

items.name: Paneer Pakoda
items.description: A popular Indian snack made with paneer (Indian cottage cheese) that is coated in a spiced gram flour batter and deep-fried to crispy perfection.

items.name: Rajma Chawal
items.description: Red kidney beans cooked in a flavourful gravy with onion, tomato, ginger, garlic and spices and topped with fresh garam masala and coriander. Served with steamy rice and papad.

items.name: Dal Dhokli
items.description: A popular comforting Gujarati dish cooked with yellow lentils with sweet and tangy flavours cooked with spicy flatbread sheets.
items.extra: make it a meal with rice + side salad + achar + papad

items.name: Murg Banjara
items.description: A robust Indian chicken curry, where tender pieces of chicken are slow-cooked in a medley of aromatic spices, creating a rich and flavorful dish.
items.extra: make it a meal with 2 parathas + side salad + achar + papad

items.name: Mirchi Pakoda
items.description: A popular Indian snack, features green chili peppers coated in a spiced gram flour batter and deep-fried to golden perfection, delivering a delightful crunch with a fiery kick. Served with green chutney.

items.name: Dal Bati Churma
items.description: A traditional Rajasthani dish that consists of baked wheat-flour balls (bati) served with lentil curry (dal) and a sweet crumbled mixture of wheat, ghee, and sugar (churma).

items.name: Chettinad Mushroom Biryani
items.description: A flavorful and spicy South Indian rice dish that incorporates mushrooms as the main ingredient. It's known for its rich and aromatic blend of Chettinad spices and is popular in Chettinad cuisine of Tamil Nadu. This biryani is made by cooking mushrooms and rice with a mixture of aromatic spices and herbs, resulting in a delicious and satisfying one-pot meal. Served with yogurt raita + achar + papad.

items.name: Ambur Biryani
items.description: A popular biryani variety from the town of Ambur in the southern Indian state of Tamil Nadu. It is made by cooking fragrant basmati rice with chicken, and a blend of spices like cinnamon, cloves, cardamom, and coriander. Served with yogurt raita + achar + papad

items.name: Sundal
items.description: A popular South Indian snack made with chickpeas and coconut packed with a lot of flavour.

items.name: Lemon Rice
items.description: Rice, cashews, chillies and other spices stir fried together and mixed with lime juice. Served with achar + papad.

items.name: Chilli Garlic Stir Fried Noodles
items.description: A delicious and flavorful dish that combines Chinese-style stir-fried noodles with a spicy kick from chili and the pungent aroma of garlic.

items.name: Chicken Chilli Garlic Stir Fried Noodles
items.description: A delicious and flavorful dish that combines chinese-style stir-fried noodles with a spicy kick from chili and the pungent aroma of garlic.

items.name: Chicken Chilli
items.description: A savory delight where succulent pieces of chicken are wok-tossed with colorful bell peppers, onions, and a spicy chili-infused sauce, creating a tantalizing blend of flavors that's both zesty and satisfying.

items.name: Tomato Rice
items.description: Rice cooked with onions & tomato, tempered with mustard seeds, peanuts and fresh curry leaves. Served with papad.

items.name: Chana Palak Masala
items.description: A nutritious and flavorful Indian dish where chickpeas (chana) are simmered in a vibrant spinach-based curry (palak masala). This hearty and wholesome combination brings together the protein-rich chickpeas with the goodness of spinach, creating a delicious and aromatic curry that's both nourishing and satisfying.
items.extra: make it a meal with 2 parathas + side salad + achar + papad

items.name: Chicken Tikka Masala
items.description: Marinated and grilled chicken pieces (chicken tikka) are tossed in a creamy and spiced tomato-based curry (masala). This classic fusion dish is known for its rich, savory taste, combining the smokiness of the tandoori-cooked chicken with the lusciousness of the creamy tomato based sauce.
items.extra: make it a meal with 2 parathas or rice + side salad

items.name: Aloo Chaat
items.description: A popular Indian street food that features boiled and diced potatoes (aloo) tossed with various spices and chutneys. This flavorful and tangy snack is garnished with fresh coriander, chopped onions, and sev, creating a delightful medley of textures and tastes.

items.name: Chole Chawal
items.description: A popular North Indian dish featuring spicy and tangy chickpea curry (chole) served with steamed basmati rice (chawal). This classic combination offers a hearty and satisfying meal, with the robust flavors of the chickpea curry complementing the fluffy rice

items.name: Hyderabadi Mirchi ka Salan
items.description: A tangy and spicy curry made with green chilies, in a peanut and sesame seed-based gravy. This Hyderabadi dish is known for its distinctive flavor profile, balancing heat from the chilies with the nuttiness of the spices
items.extra: make it a meal with 2 parathas + side salad + achar + papad

items.name: Hyderabadi Chicken Korma
items.description: A delectable dish hailing from the culinary traditions of Hyderabad. In this preparation, tender chicken pieces are cooked in a luxurious and aromatic curry made with a blend of rich spices, yogurt, cream, and nuts. The result is a creamy, flavorful chicken korma that showcases the distinctive tastes of Hyderabadi cuisine
items.extra: make it a meal with 2 parathas or rice + side salad

items.name: Paneer 65
items.description: A popular Indian appetizer made with cubes of paneer (Indian cottage cheese) that have been marinated in a blend of spices and then deep-fried until crispy. The dish is spiced with a mix of chili powder, cumin, and coriander.

items.name: Hyderabadi Khatti Dal and Chawal
items.description: A tangy and flavorful lentil dish from the Hyderabadi cuisine. It features tangy tamarind and tomatos, along with a blend of spices, cooked with yellow lentils. The result is a deliciously sour and aromatic dal that pairs well with rice.

items.name: Veg Maratha
items.description: A recipe from the Dhabas of India. Mix veggie balls fried and then cooked in a spicy and flavourful gravy made of onion, tomato and different spices.
items.extra: make it a meal with 2 parathas + side salad + achar + papad

items.name: Chicken Changezi
items.description: Chicken marinated and cooked with yogurt, cream, onion, tomato, ginger, garlic and lots of fresh spices.
items.extra: make it a meal with 2 parathas or rice + side salad

items.name: Moong Dal Bhajiya
items.description: A popular Indian snack made from yellow moong dal (split green gram) batter, seasoned with spices, and deep-fried to golden perfection.

items.name: Phodni Bhaat
items.description: Known as Tadka Rice or Tempered Rice, is a simple yet flavorful rice dish from Maharashtra. It involves cooking rice and then giving it a tempering or tadka with mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, green chilies, and sometimes peanuts or cashews. This tempering process imparts a delicious aroma and adds a burst of flavor to the rice, making it a quick and tasty meal.
